jpo
Class CleverJTree

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JTree
                  jpo.CleverJTree
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.dnd.DragGestureListener, java.awt.dnd.DragSourceListener, java.awt.dnd.DropTargetListener, java.util.EventListener, GroupPopupInterface, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, javax.swing.Scrollable, java.io.Serializable
public class CleverJTree
extends javax.swing.JTree
implements java.awt.dnd.DropTargetListener, java.awt.dnd.DragSourceListener, java.awt.dnd.DragGestureListener, GroupPopupInterface

The is one of the main classes in the JPO application as it is an extended JTree that deals with most of the logic surrounding the collection and the user interactions with it.

See Also:

Field Detail

dropTarget

java.awt.dnd.DropTarget dropTarget
enables this component to be a dropTarget

dragSource

java.awt.dnd.DragSource dragSource
enables this component to be a Drag Source

popupNode

public SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode popupNode
a temporaty object that serves as a reference to the node that was selected when the popup menu was activated. When the user selects the action on the popup menu this node is then used as the starting point.

popupPath

private javax.swing.tree.TreePath popupPath
a temporaty object that serves as a reference to the node that was selected when the popup menu was activated. When the user selects the action on the popup menu this node is then used as the starting point.

caller

private CleverJTreeInterface caller
a reference back to the creating object for functions that that object must implement. Currently this is used only for the find method as this should be delegated back to the Application Frame.

top

private SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode top
The top node of the tree data model. It holds all the branches to the groups and pictures

associatedThumbnailJScrollPane

private ThumbnailJScrollPane associatedThumbnailJScrollPane
a reference to the Thumbnail Pane that is displaying pictures. This allows the CleverJTree to tell the Thumbnail Pane to display groups of pictures via it's showGroup method.

associatedInfoPanel

private InfoPanel associatedInfoPanel
a reference to the Info Panel that is displaying information. This allows the CleverJTree to tell the Info Panel about selections via it's showInfo method.

closedFolderIcon

private static final javax.swing.ImageIcon closedFolderIcon
Icon of a closed folder to be used on groups that are not expanded in the JTree.

openFolderIcon

private static final javax.swing.ImageIcon openFolderIcon
Icon of an open folder to be used on groups that are expanded in the JTree.

pictureIcon

private static final javax.swing.ImageIcon pictureIcon
Icon of a picture for use on picture bearing nodes in the JTree.

Constructor Detail

CleverJTree

public CleverJTree(CleverJTreeInterface caller,
                   SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode rootNode)
Constructs a JTree.

Parameters:
caller - The object to which the find request should be delegated back to. This will be the main application.
rootNode - The root node of the tree.
Method Detail

setAssociatedThumbnailJScrollpane

public void setAssociatedThumbnailJScrollpane(ThumbnailJScrollPane associatedThumbnailJScrollPane)
This method assigns the supplied ThumbnailJScrollpane with this JTree. This association is used to allow the JTree to order the ThumbnailJScrollpane to display a different group.

setAssociatedInfoPanel

public void setAssociatedInfoPanel(InfoPanel associatedInfoPanel)
This method assigns the supplied InfoPanel with this JTree. This association is used to allow the JTree to tell the InfoPanel to show information about selections.

setSelectedNode

public void setSelectedNode(SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode selectedNode)
Moves the highlighted row to the indicated one and makes sure it is on the screen.

callback method that is called when a drag gesture has been initiated on a node of the JTree.

dragGestureRecognized in interface java.awt.dnd.DragGestureListener

dragEnter

public void dragEnter(java.awt.dnd.DropTargetDragEvent event)
this callback method is invoked every time something is dragged onto the JTree. We check if the desired DataFlavor is supported and then reject the drag if it is not.

Specified by:
dragEnter in interface java.awt.dnd.DropTargetListener

dragEnter

public void dragEnter(java.awt.dnd.DragSourceDragEvent event)
this callback method is invoked after the dropTaget had a chance to evaluate the drag event and was given the option of rejecting or modifying the event. This method sets the cursor to reflect whether a copy, move or no drop is possible.

Specified by:
dragEnter in interface java.awt.dnd.DragSourceListener

dragOver

public void dragOver(java.awt.dnd.DropTargetDragEvent event)
this callback method is invoked every time something is dragged over the JTree. We check if the desired DataFlavor is supported and then reject the drag if it is not.

Specified by:
dragOver in interface java.awt.dnd.DropTargetListener

dragOver

public void dragOver(java.awt.dnd.DragSourceDragEvent event)
this callback method is invoked after the dropTaget had a chance to evaluate the dragOver event and was given the option of rejecting or modifying the event. This method sets the cursor to reflect whether a copy, move or no drop is possible.

Specified by:
dragOver in interface java.awt.dnd.DragSourceListener

dropActionChanged

public void dropActionChanged(java.awt.dnd.DropTargetDragEvent event)
this callback method is invoked when the user presses or releases Ctrl when doing a drag. He can signal that he wants to change the copy / move of the operation. This method could intercept this change and could modify the event if it needs to. Here we use this as a convenient handle to expand and collapse the Tree.

Specified by:
dropActionChanged in interface java.awt.dnd.DropTargetListener

dropActionChanged

public void dropActionChanged(java.awt.dnd.DragSourceDragEvent event)
this callback method is invoked when the user presses or releases shift when doing a drag. He can signal that he wants to change the copy / move of the operation. This method changes the cursor to reflect the mode of the operation.

Specified by:
dropActionChanged in interface java.awt.dnd.DragSourceListener

dragExit

public void dragExit(java.awt.dnd.DropTargetEvent event)
this callback method is invoked to tell the dropTarget that the drag has moved on to something else. We do nothing here.

Specified by:
dragExit in interface java.awt.dnd.DropTargetListener

dragExit

public void dragExit(java.awt.dnd.DragSourceEvent event)
this callback method is invoked to tell the dragSource that the drag has moved on to something else. We do nothing here.

Specified by:
dragExit in interface java.awt.dnd.DragSourceListener

drop

public void drop(java.awt.dnd.DropTargetDropEvent event)
Entry point for the drop event. Figures out which node the drop occured on and sorts out the drop action in the data model.

requestSlideshow

requests the group to be shown.

Specified by:
requestSlideshow in interface GroupPopupInterface
See Also:
GroupPopupInterface

requestFind

public void requestFind()
This method can be invoked by the GroupPopupMenu. The find request is delegated up to the object that created the tree because there are two versions: either the search results are attached to the tree or the search results are only displayed in the thumbnail pane. The caller created the instances and thus must delegate the search. If the results are to be saved the called currently calls the SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode.findAndSave(jpo.Query) method.

Specified by:
requestFind in interface GroupPopupInterface
See Also:
GroupPopupInterface

requestEditGroupNode in interface GroupPopupInterface
